sn54.4:1.1: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.4:1.2: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
sn54.4:1.3: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
sn54.4:1.4: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …
sn54.4:1.5: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’
sn54.4:1.6: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.4:1.7: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect one of two results:
sn54.4:1.8: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
